get.summary: Find accounts in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all accounts whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 50 records will be returned.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for accounts last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all accounts are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 50 if not supplied. A page size larger than 50 is not supported at this time

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field(s) to order by. For example to order by firstname ascending use 'firstname asc'
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`

For example, to search for all leads whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 50 records will be returned.
